ygData.subject: Re: This is what I have so far on jewelry
ygData.msgSnippet: This is a great list!  Thanks for compiling it for us. You are not maxed for your level. Trade skills do not max out by level. You can raise it as high as you
ygData.messageBody:
This is a great list! Thanks for compiling it for us.

You are not maxed for your level. Trade skills do not max out by level.
You can raise it as high as you can afford to practice with the tools
of the trade.

For most trades there is som eorder in which you should do things, as
your skill will develop most cost effectively in this manner. For
jewel craft you can get up to 2 skill points with each stone (with
silver), if you do them in order of cheapest to most expensive. I
didn't note the whole list, as I started at skill of 21. FOr skill
points 31 and 32, use carnelian, for points 33 and 34, use rose quartz,
for 35 and 36 use Amber, etc. up to Black Pearl. Then you should be
able to start over with electrum. I haven't gotten that far yet, so I
don't know.

If you try to use a stone below your level, it tells you that that
stone is too trivial for you.

Q. of E'ci
--- Drew Silsby <asilsby1@...> wrote:
> From: "Drew Silsby" <asilsby1@...>
>
> Ok, I have been keeping track of different
> combinations of jewels and this
> is my list thus far in response to The Wanderer's
> post.
> All of the below were made with Enchanted Bar's of
> silver.
>
> 1 Enchanted Bar of Silver + 1 Malachite =
> Silver Malachite Ring
> 1 Enchanted Bar of Silver + 1 Labis Lazuli =
> Silver Labis Lazuli
> Ring
> 1 Enchanted Bar of Silver + 1 Turquoise =
> Silver Turquois
> Bracelet
> 1 Enchanted Bar of Silver + 1 Hematite =
> Silver Hematite Ring
> 1 Enchanted Bar of Silver + 1 Cat's Eye Agate =
> Silver Cat's Eye Necklace
> 1 Enchanted Bar of Silver + 1 Bloodstone =
> Silver Bloodstone
> Earring
> 1 Enchanted Bar of Silver + 1 Onyx =
> Silver Onyx
> Bracelet
> 1 Enchanted Bar of Silver + 1 Jasper =
> Silver Jasper Ring
> 1 Enchanted Bar of Silver + 1 Carnelian =
> Silver Carnelian
> Wedding Ring
> 1 Enchanted Bar of Silver + 1 Star Rose Quartz =
> Silver Rose Engagement Ring
> 1 Enchanted Bar of Silver + 1 Amber =
> Silver Amber Ring
>
> Notice even though I used enchanted siver for all of
> the above no magical
> jewelry was produced. Apparently a more expensive
> type of metal must be
> used to get magic jewelry out of the above stones.
> Below is a short list of the magic jewelry that I
> have created using
> enchanted silver.
>
> 1 Enchanted Bar of Silver + 1 Jade = Jaded
> Silver Ring,
> Effect: MANA +5
> 1 Enchanted Bar of Silver + 1 Pearl =
> Silvered Pearl Ring,
> Effect: VS POISON +4
> 1 Enchanted Bar of Silver + 1 Topaz = Topaz
> Silver Necklace,
> Effect: VS DISEASE +4
>
> Also I was wondering why there are four slots in the
> jewelry kit. So I
> briefly tried a couple attempts using multiple
> stones. Since both attempts
> were unsuccesful and this type of experimenting is
> expensive I discontinued
> this experiment until later. These are the failed
> attempts:
>
> 1 Enchanted Bar of Silver + 1 Malachite + 1 Lapis
> Lazuli = "These
> combinations and quantities of items fail to
> combine to produce anything."
> 1 Bar of Silver + 1 Lapis Lazuli + 1 Turquoise =
> "These combinations and
> quantities of items fail to combine to produce
> anything."
>
> If anyone can add to this list, please feel free.
> Also, if anyone can tell me how the skill cap is
> calculated for jewelcraft I
> would like to know, I have a level 14 Enchanter who
> has a 30 in jewelcraft.
> After hitting 30 my skill has not risen even after
> numerous attempts to
> raise it. Am I maxed for my level?
>
>
> Fren
> Gnome, Enchanter
> Tunare Server
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
